It's much bigger than I imagined on the inside!   I can't speak for the food just yet since we only went for late night fun but I'll definitely be trying it soon!   But as for late night, I had a blast. The dj was awesome and he had the videos playing to the music all over the bar. He played some great throwback along with top 40. There were good specials going on and the bartenders were really friendly. We just danced all night which is just what you need sometimes!   We loved it so much we got tickets to the NYE party! So excited for this!

Stopped by on a Saturday night to grab a few drinks and it was packed. We finally managed to get a few beers and then later went back to get a rum and coke and a Long Island ice tea. Not sure if the bar tenders are actually trained in how to make drinks as the Long Island was far from what a true Long Island is and the rum and coke was more coke then rum. While we know it was busy - our service was horrible as the two female bar tenders were more concerned with chatting and assisting the younger crowd that was there. Won't be back.

It has been quite some time since I've hung out in the downtown Charlotte area - let alone try to visit the corner of 5th and College.  Even though Fitzgerald's replaced Buckhead's (a long time Charlotte staple since I've been here) I was taken aback at all the changes they made to the inside of the place.  They've classed it up a bit to make it much more than a bar... it's better suited for meals now.  It was funny being greeted by a hostess since I was just used to just going in and barring it up.  We were just planning on picking up tickets for an upcoming bar crawl, but we ended up eating dinner here.  The menu is quite large with some authentic Irish dishes.  I tried the Fish & Chips....  Usually I don't really expect much having been through my share of over-breaded, badly fried fish portions... but the breading here was nice and light with the fish perfectly cooked and moist.  The fries were nice a crispy too... way too many places present you with some cold, limp fries.  Lucky for us, Wednesday nights are Pint Nights!  all pints are $3 (with exception to Guinness... which made me somewhat sad).  It was still a good time.

I've been here a few times over the years -- it's got a great location! Right in the heart of uptown a block away from The Epicenter. However, I had never truly experienced Fitzgerald's until I watched The Steelers game there this past Saturday. Man oh man! Black and yellow wall to wall! Steelers fans are one-of-a-kind and can be a bit much so hat's off to Fitz for being the official Steelers bar in Charlotte. I'm sure they catch a lot of crap but they handled it very well. The waitress was nice and the bar service was surprisingly quick considering the crowds. I'll be back for sure.. though I'll make sure to wear black and yellow if Pittsburgh is playing!  I hear they've got food too so next time I'll have to sample some.

This is a beautiful, big space with tons of TV's!  Even better...it's a Steeler's Bar!  They have a DJ that works during commercials.  The staff is friendly & on top of service.  They have Woodchuck on tap as well as Harp, Guinness & Smithwick's.  They also have a nice patio on the front of the restaurant.  The food looked decent, but basically bar food & we just went for drinks & the game, so I can't comment on the quality of it.  BONUS!!!  They validate your parking in the garage attached to their building!

Don't waste your time! Ordered a drink.... flat and tasteless!  Bartender was more interested in taking with his buddy at the end of the bar and flirting with all the girls coming in than tend bar!   The special Bloody Mary came with no olive or celery it tasted like crap but I got to sit and listen to the Bartender talk crap about some customer who left his credit card referring to him as "dick head" while he kissed and hugged some under age appearing female patron!  Must be the reason there was only six people in the place!  I'm never coming here again!

My husband and I really liked Fitzgerald's.  The service was great, the food was very tasty and the beer was cold and so good!  I had the Black & Blue sliders and they were delicious and my husband raved about the Steak Sandwich.   The restaurant has a very comfortable atmosphere.  Nice bar area with TVs and quite dining areas, too.  Great place for a night out with your honey or to meet up with a group of friends.   You also can't beat the location...central to Time Warner Arena, Blumenthal, and EpiCenter.   We are always looking for a place to eat whenever we are uptown for a sporting or theatrical event....looks like we have found our place!

the fried pickle was only okay. their food just looked mediocre. their drinks, well their beer was alright.  if you're not from NC, make sure to ask for local brews and not your regular stuff because why the hell not

God, they just try so hard. They have great specials, a huge space and it seems to be really easy to win a happy hour for your friends but this place is just always empty and when you have a giant empty bar it's hard to have fun.  CLT might just have too many irish bars for their to be room for this place but I wish them success because they look like they're doing everything they can to bring in more people.

Have you been to Stool Pigeons, Picasso's, or Fox and Hound Lately? Then you have been to Fitzgerald's only their dinner and drink service are not up to par. This place has zero zing... zero. There is nothing special about it and no reason other than the free parking to have a drink or eat there. Their best drink special of the day, a $3 Blue Moon, ran out by 8:15 on opening night and it wasn't nearly as busy as I have seen the old Buckheads get. .   The first Blue Moon I drank had an overwhelming taste/scent of onion as if someone cut an Orange with the safe knife or cutting board as they used to chop onions...gross. I did ask the server about it and so my second (yes I braved another) actually tasted much better.   I ordered the shrimp entree for $11.95. This was definitely an appetizer portion. I was served ten shrimp which were not very large on an appetizer plate with a side of cut up onions with a dash of mealy tomatoes and three small pieces (half of my pinky size) of browned avocado. I couldn't taste the lime and it was very-much under-seasoned. Eating a plate of mushy onions was not appetizing and therefore it mostly remained untouched on my plate. I didn't complain because I already felt bad for the onion-beer complaint but it was fairly obvious my side wasn't touched. The food quality was unacceptable.   Service was ok for a first night and I'm sure she probably was more than a bit nervous. A more nuanced server might have thought to comp the first beer or notice my side was still glaringly on my appetizer/entree plate...but I won't fault her too much since it was their grand opening and therefore an expected learning curve.  I will say the place looked nicer than Buckheads which is definitely a plus. I hope they get better...a lot better.

I'm a fan of Fitzgerald's and so this place gets a slightly higher rating, but based on the reuben alone it would be a 1. It's a great place to drink and they do have some good food on the menu, but the reuben is not one of those things.  I continued my reuben adventure around Charlotte with a place I thought would have a good reuben, an Irish spot. I was quite wrong. The corned beef was terrible - it was this rubbery substance that was clearly boiled, poorly, and didn't have any flavor at all. The sandwich was soggy as the standard marbled rye wasn't crisped up at all, and the kraut just didn't add much to the sandwich as it lacked the proper tartness required. The sandwich was covered in melted cheese, but that can only do so much to make up for the rest of a bad sandwich.  Fitzgerald's is a good spot with decent food and a great atmosphere - just don't make the same mistake I did and order a reuben.

Come here periodically, food is always good, solid bar food! Tonight was a busy night and Clara* check my spelling* killed it. We had a large group but still great service! Will come back without hesitation.

Downtown (Uptown, whatever) is not really my stomping ground. The last time I was anywhere near this place, it was Buckhead (Saloon?), if that tells you much of anything. And while I did venture inside, it was only to use the facilities. The rest of the time, I was on the patio, which is nice.  I had a drink or three, and they were good enough, but the service, such as it is, wasn't the greatest I've seen. Could be because it was the patio. Could have been because it was the afternoon. Or it could be because you don't really go to this sort of place for the service, you know?

Another first! Went a walk and came across here! Walked in and they were very friendly and the place was cool. It was hot outside!  Stop to have a beer and the bartender was a sweetheart! Good service and cold beer. I would recommend it here.

Had a great experience at Fitzgerald's today. Stopped in before seeing a movie and was craving a burger. Highly recommend the A1 Burger- .   Decided to sit at the bar where Tom greeted me first thing. He let me sample the Sam Adam's 76 which was a tasty suggestion.   I will definitely be returning back to Fitzgerald's soon!

I came here on a trip to see UNCC and got a bit hungry, so decided to check out the downtown area. The Mac and cheese and spinach and artichoke dip are DYNAMITE. I got very good service, but did not come during happy hour. They were doing a charity event to help with pediatric oncology so I decided to give them some money toward it. All staff was very, very kind knowing I'm not from around the area and helped me out a lot with the menu, since there's so much on it.i definitely would recommend coming here again at a quieter time if you had bad service. Definitely one of my top placed to back to when I move to CLT.

I've been trying to update some of my older reviews lately. While on the book of face today, I saw a flier for Fitz's three year anniversary party and thought it was time to re-visit this one.   Why this place wins: it's the closest restaurant/bar to TWC Arena AND they validate parking for the Wake Forest Garage. So, don't throw your garage ticket on the dashboard and remember to bring it inside with you. And when you bring it inside, don't forget to ask your server or bartender to validate the ticket for you.  Leaving the arena after a big event is always a pain, but especially know because of all the construction outside. I'll usually walk over to Fitz's for a drink after a game or show and wait for the traffic to clear. The patio is fantastic for people watching.  Menu-wise, I think the food has gotten better over the years. I usually order the Drop-Kick Chicken Sandwich. Buffalo sauce and bleu cheese make everything delicious. App wise I go with pretzel bites (beer mustard and queso dipping sauce FTW) and the wings. I mix hot and teriyaki sauces. I haven't had the chipotle mango, but it's next on my list to try.  Service can be hit or miss here. I've had good and not so good experiences here. This is a Penn State and Steelers bar. Steeler Sundays are nuts. Get there early. They also have IC Light for game day.  Looking at how this place has developed and changed over the past three years, I  would say this place is somewhere between a 3.5 and 4. I think they've earned that extra star.

Poor service. Poor quality food. Discussed specifics with manager. Indifferent attitude. For example wing appetizer was dried out. Sauce was flavorful but dry.  Explained my dissatisfaction to manager his response was "some of our customers like Krispy wings.  Ok. So they are aware they cater to the overcooked Krispy wing crowd.
I have been there several times for Steelers games and have always had a very good experience with the food and staff.  My only complaint is the high price for drinks, especially on a Sunday.

If you like fresh, good, normal food check out the Brunch at Fitzgerald's. The restaurant is a nice break from the "fancy & eccentric" food from other places nearby. Food on brunch buffet is fresh, simple and some of the best I've had on a buffet in the Madison area. I would highly recommended a visit to Fitzgerald's any Sunday morning.

Don't even know why we went there but we regret it. The ambiance was cold dark and shabby.  The food was cold poor quality and poorly prepared.  There is nothing to recommend here.  It used to be a good place.

Where to start with such a great experience. The bar set up was dope really gave a home town feel to the restaurant. Started with the Fitzgerald's platter and hummus for an appetizer. The platter contains all my favorite things. Nice and hot too!!! Mozzarella cheese squares melted into long strips as you pulled it apart. The sweet and spicy wings were everything!!! Shout out to Paul Booker. Everyone should try the Mac and cheese plate. By far my favorite dish especially if you add salmon. Salmon was cooked to perfection. Shrimp Po boy was nice and crispy, full of flavor. Finished with a tiramisu cup life couldn't be sweeter!!! Thanks for the great service and experience Fitzgerald's. I can not wait to make it back to try more items.

This is a cool little joint to come to and grab a beer.  Relaxed atmosphere and can get pretty crazy and busy on the weekends.  The fact that Wake Forest is directly above it definitely helps that crowd.

Just re-opened with some of the same folks working that you will see in this video!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rM98yYylDlE  Ordered a two inch cut of prime rib to go with all the trimmings (mashed taters, au jus, creamed corn and salad bar) and four pieces of broasted chicken with some french fires and cole slaw. It all was very tatsty as it used to be! And it only cost $19.75 total!  They even had a two for one coupon so I get the next meal free! WOW!!

So, this place is more-deserving of three stars than the previous two-star rating.  I should be writing new reviews for the new places that I've been but I have to give a shout-out to Lauren S, the manager who reached out quickly after my previous rating.  Me and some peepz happened to be in the area so we dropped in to grab a few more drinks... opera at the Belk would've been pretty sweet, but $3 vodka happy hour wins when one is slightly already inebriated.  With no fat lady in sight, the night had just begun.    But this review is just over.  The place was really solid and the staff was perfectly fine.  Great service recovery.    dmo out

I recently visited Fitzgeralds on a Friday night with some friends. When going to the bar to order, I saw that they had a special that read "$3.50 Select Ales."  I ordered two, then watched as the bartender poured out two Miller Lites.  When she brought back the drinks, I explained that Miller Lite isn't an ale at all, but a pilsner (which is a style of lager.) She first asked "What's the difference?" When I explained the differences, she shrugged her shoulders and said, "That's just what we call it," then walked off.  Beers can be split up into two categories: lagers and ales. Lagers (which include pilsners) use a bottom-fermenting yeast and have what the casual drinker would describe as a "crisp" taste, and ales (which include IPAs, porters, and stouts) use a top-fermenting yeast.   Even to the average beer drinker, this doesn't make sense. Getting a Miller Lite when you order an ale is like getting a tuna sandwich after you ordered the caviar.  At best, this is marketing laziness, at worst it's an outright lie.

Typically always a fun, lively atmosphere. I tend to travel here a lot before Charlotte Checkers games or after work for for their happy hour, which is half-priced apps til 6 or 7pm. And I really like that they validate parking after 5pm - a rariety in Uptown!  The happy hour is full of variety with plenty of options.The nachos plate is huge and definitely something to share. Smaller apps, like the ahi tuna or chicken fingers, are great for single serve. The only thing I've ever been turned off by has been the fried pickles. They taste as though they are simply tossed in flour and fried til brown... no seasoning to really speak of and a lack of flavor. But everything else is good to snack on!  My only complaint, and the reason for the 3 stars, is the service. I've been here no less than a dozen times and each time I typically get mediocre service and a few times, just down right rude servers. Coming from the service industry, if you are busy, no problem and I get it.   One insistance my friends and myself traveled to Fitz to start our Saturday night. The server was busy, which caused for slow service, but was friendly and you could tell she was trying. The manager James saw my friend in a birthday tiara and served us a round of shots - props to James for being awesome sauce! I still go here a good bit but know that if I have somewhere to be at a certain point, I usually dine elsewhere.

We've been to Fitzgerald's three times since my son started at UW.  We were looking for a place to get a good steak that was more of a homey, comfortable place rather than the upscale/glitz offered at a number of other steakhouses in the Madison area.  We were happy with our choice.  If you are looking for upscale/glitz or culinary innovation, this isn't the place for you.  The look is a little dated, but clean and well cared for.  I'm a little old fashioned I guess, when I go to a restaurant it is for the meal and not the "experience."    Between myself and my family over the three visits we had a number of entrees, including prime rib, filet mignon, broasted chicken, barbeque ribs and fettuccini alfredo.  My daughter reported the fettuccini as mediocre, but each of the other entrees was tasty, cooked to specifications and well portioned.  We tried most of the side dishes and the only one we would not order again was the rice.  We had several appetizers including cheese curds and onion rings; all were very good.  Fresh, warm bread was served (and more offered when it was finished) and the soup/salad bar, while not extensive, was very good.  Prices weren't cheap, but were reasonable for what we got.  Service was very good without the pretentiousness we've encountered at more upscale places.    Not the place for everyone, I'm sure, but we were very happy with it and I'm sure we will go again the next time we are in town.  The Sunday brunch looks very interesting, I'd like to try that.

A good place to dance. The wife and I go there for that and some shots once in a while.   Went there with friends last month during the Rich & Bennett Pub Crawl too. Had a good time. Not sure what their food taste like so I'll probably update this once I try them. Nothing fancy or bad about it from our experience.  The DJ kills it with some latest and some NINETIES shiz. Makes us folks who crossed over to the third decade go crazy.
This place wasn't too shabby! Great environment to catch games and munch on some bar food. When I came here we sat at the back bar and the bartender was AMAZING. He was very attentive and personal!

As someone who's uncle owned an Irish Pub back in the day, I am so trying to like this place.  After a bad experience a couple years back I decided to give it another try.  What I experienced on a Saturday night was deplorable.  Just as before, the service was anything but the friendly, welcoming atmosphere that goes with real Irish pubs.  Bartenders don't have to have a big phony smile but neither do they have to act like taking a simple drink order for one person is a huge, painful ordeal.  Then, as I was watching a closely contested sporting contest on one of their TVs, the place without warning turned into a cheesy dance club complete with unnecessarily risque and provocative images across the TV screens and songs with distasteful lyrics.   This type of objectification of women has no place in an establishment that advertises itself as an Irish pub.  Not surprisingly, it seemed to attract some low level rift raft with poor manners and objectionable attitudes.  After a previous bad review, management did respond and asked for some feedback.  I'm ready to offer that now.  My feedback is this.  Close this place down!  Right now!  Okay that's a bit extreme.  How about then changing the name at least away from an Irish Pub?  As a gesture of goodwill, I'm come up with a number of suggestions for a new name.  The Place Where Everyone Goes for Free Parking Validation Douchebag Central Schitzgerald's Too Lazy to Walk to the Epicenter Charlotte Home for the Surly, Unhappy Bartender The Trump Dump And my personal favorite, Craplebees

Spend your money elsewhere--like at establishments with friendly staff, with kitchens who serve respectable food and with owners who believe in providing customer service.  This is hardly breaking news considering the litany of negative reviews already posted, but the new-ish owners/management will destroy what was once considered a friendly, tasty, neighborhood restaurant. The writing is on the wall.  The restaurant was about 10% full at 6pm on a Thursday night (ominous bad sign) and that was the high point of our evening. If out of sheer morbid curiosity you'd like to read more about our experience, read on:  1. Our waiter was clearly new and unprepared as he did not know the evening's dinner specials and "had to check with someone," which meant he would need to come back.   2. He later brought an incorrect entree and actually argued with one of our diners on how he had taken the proper order--he later admitted he was wrong and then offered to replace it.  3. Two of our entrees came out at the same time, the third arrived 5 minutes later, and the fourth entree (grilled chicken) came out 10 minutes after that.  4. My baked potato was cooked perfectly--as was the black and crackled, golf ball sized rotten segment burgeoning from the top and staring at me.  5. When asked to speak to the manager, it took over 15 minutes for our waiter to find him, presumably because he was napping given that we were one of 5 tables.  6. While waiting for the manager to emerge, I elected to see the hostess who was busy on her phone and recognized my presence only after finishing texting her sentence.  7. The manager listened to my re-telling of our experience with a blank stare and asked, "What would you like me to do?"  Here's what I'd like for you to do... take pride in your business, make sure your employees are doing their jobs before putting them on the floor, and most of all, give a damn...or at least pretend to.

The scene was a Friday night out with my friends. I had quite a bit to drink so I got up to use the restroom. As I approached down the hallway, the music of the bar began to be replaced by music of a different sort. At some point I realized that the music was actually coming from the bathroom, however I was not at all prepared for what I was about too walk into. The bathroom attendant. Quite possibly the coolest MF I have ever seen, on par with Samuel Jackson, greeted me with a slight head tilt and a faint smile. This man was wearing sunglasses inside and shredding a Dj turn table while pumping soap and handing towels out. I was at the urinal vibing to no diggity down to my soul in the most epic piss I've ever taken. When finished I saw a collection of every candy and gum that you could imagine along with cologne, condoms, lotion, and raw unadulterated swag.  It's for this reason alone that I give 5 starts, cause I really don't no much about the place.

Now, I have to say I've only been here once for a Yelp event and I'm not sure if the chef that made our dinner is their house chef or a guy they brought with them... That being said, I'll comment more on the layout, service and overall vibe...  There is plenty of bar seating which likely makes this a cool place to come hang out... There's even a separate section with another bar up on risers and a dining area directly across from it... They do not have a way to cordon that off from the regular restaurant noise, though, so if you're trying to rent some space there, I would keep that in mind...   Their restrooms were pretty clean by Uptown bar standards and there were about 8 stalls, so I was definitely surprised and pleased with that... Normally, the lines are huge at a place like this, but that's got to help...   I'm going to tell you, the servers here were some of the best that I've encountered... Quick, frlendly and a lot of fun... They really seemed to want everyone to have a great experience and it showed...    They validate parking from the Wake Forest lot, so yay for that!  Who likes to pay for parking?  Not this lady...   I'll have to go back again to make sure the good food was really theirs, but I'll make sure to do an update when I get around to it!  Until then, this looks like a safe bet for some drinks and a nighttime hang...

Fitzgerald's is the place to end up for many reasons. The first obvious reason is because they validate parking! All you have to do is buy a beer and boom your parking is paid for. A genius way to beat the high prices of parking around uptown. The parking lot you need to find is the Wake Forest deck, which is just down the street from it.   Another reason to stop here is if you are a Steelers fan (or Penn State). Game day here is the Steelers HQ. So weekends when there is college and pro football it's going to be a hopping place. Charlotte seems to have a LOT Of Steeler fans.   Throughout the week, Fitz has some really great deals including their burgers that go on special on Tuesday. Make it out for their pint night and play some trivia. They give away really awesome prizes!   Also make a pit stop before a Hornets game and buy cheaper food and drinks then when you walk into the stadium and prices skyrocket. Don't forget to enjoy their outdoor patio seating that's nice and perfect for watching the streets of Charlotte!

I haven't been back, nor will I ever go back to Fitzgeralds.  Their New Years Eve event was the worst that I've ever attended.  I've been trying to get a refund of my ticket price because I didn't get even close to my money's worth due to a dangerously over capacity crowd, a glassware shortage, slow bartenders, and a "breakfast buffet" that never materialized.  I've been trying to resolve this issue with the manager, Mike Palmer, and all he did was offer me a coupon to return and "give Fitzgeralds another try".  The problem is that I don't want to go back and eat/drink in an establishment like Fitzgeralds.  I would simply like either the manager or the owner to call me, which I've requested at least a half dozen times since the event, but I still haven't heard from anyone.  Even if there is no refund, I would still like them to answer simple questions like why were the bartenders overserving patrons that night (I routinely saw single customers order 4 or more drinks at a time), how many tickets were sold vs. the max capacity of the venue, and what officials witnessed the crowd that night and deemed it safe to continue selling tickets or letting patrons enter the building.  Very dissapointing customer service, very irresponsible way to run a bar/restaurant.  Very upset customers.

Came here on a suggestion from our uber driver, we wanted to watch the game and get some food. Starting at 9pm they start their late night menu which consisted of chicken tenders, chicken wings, or fries.   Service wasn't great, we had to ask a few different times to ensure our drinks and part of our food order was on our way out. The chicken tenders were to die for, the chicken wings were disappointing for a sports bar.   Plenty of TVs and good atmosphere but the rest kind of fell short.

Fun sports bar. This is the official Penn State bar, so I've come here a couple times now with my bf who's an alumni. Not sure if this is just a game day thing, but they have beer towers (~100 oz of beer in this cute little dispenser) of Yuengling, Miller, Blue Moon, etc for $20-22!!!!! That's like 6-7 beers right at your disposal! I've never seen this before so I think it's pretty neat. All the booths have TV's with the games playing that are built-in, which is also super neat.  As for food - it's pretty decent bar food. The boneless wings are good and I've also had the Carolina burger. Not very Carolina-y or particularly tasty, but good enough. Sweet potato fries were pretty standard, a little soggy. The atmosphere is pretty fun for night games - there was a DJ playing good tunes and we were partying everywhere. Overall a good place to watch football games and have fun.

In town visiting from Atlanta and came by Fitzgerald's. They have great food options, although I wasn't too pleased with the quinoa cranberry salad (too bland in my opinion) and the Shepard's pie (not what I expected). Our waitress, Stephanie, was absolutely amazing and had great customer service! My mom, who is very picky with her drinks, ordered their margarita and was very pleased. Overall, good place to drop by.

The service was great went for a late dinner ... it was warm so we say outside... I got the Dublin Broil... that I would give 5 stars to! My boyfriend got the the Shepard's pie... was good but not as good as mine. The beer was good my loppyrita was not that great had the guiness shot my boyfriend loved it... I had to sip mine ;) would go back again I have heard it gets crazy on holidays and sporting events so I wouldn't go then.

Worst meal and experience I have ever had at a supper club.  I grew up going to Fitzgerald's and had continued to frequent it as an adult.  This week we stopped in for the ribs and chicken special.  I was so excited for a great meal.   Service was poor, and that is being nice.   Water tasted off.  Server admitted the ice machine was broken and they knew about it but kept using the ice.   Ribs were inedible. They were covered with a dry rub that was basically just handfuls of cumin and smoked paprika.  In addition to the taste being terrible, they were dry and uninspired.   Chicken was awful.  Not only was the chicken overcooked to the point that the breading was burnt but you could taste how old the oil was. Worst broasted chicken I have ever had.  Salad bar...what a joke.  Old items, brown cauliflower, overly salty soup, poorly presented.    We were not at all happy with the meal but couldn't share our feedback because our server was no where to be found.  Finally at the end she comes to us and I casually tell her about my experience.  She takes my credit card, vanishes for 15 min, and then charges me full price. No manager table touch. No communication. Nothing.  So I then have to take the receipt and go find a manager.  He lacks the knowledge of good customer service.  His solution to the problem is a free dessert to take home, well that is crazy.  Fix the problem don't try to ignore it.  Finally after a long conversation I was given the refund and I vow to never return.  Anyone in the service industry just please follow this tip if a customer isn't happy...LAST - Listen, Apologize, Solve, Thank.  If the manager would have done these 4 things I wouldn't be writing this review.   So sad to see a once great, destination restaurant fall to such a sad sight.

I hope we caught them on an off night..  After walking around for about a half an hour trying to find a restaurant to grab dinner and drinks at before seeing a show at the Time Warner Cable Arena on a Sunday night we found Fitzgerald's which looked like an Irish Sports Bar with a great outside patio area.  We made our way to the hostess stand and asked if we could sit outside, the hostess looked very overwhelmed and wasn't even aware that there were tables outside hat were open. We made our way over to the tables and pushed them together and waited for someone to come clean them off - after about 5 minutes we sat down and pushed all the dirty dishes/glasses/checks to the end of the table. We had to go up and ask for a waitress twice and finally someone came over and took our order - leaving the dirty items and without wiping the table off. Our waitress came back a few minutes later to inform one of the members of our group that their beer choice was out, but didn't bring anyone else their drinks...  Our waitress then took our dinner orders and finally brought our beers, the member of our group who had who's original choice was out, received their drink with sentiment floating around and setting at the bottom...  Food was decent but the whole experience left a bad impression on all of us,I doubt anyone will return to this establishment if we are in the Charlotte area again.

I came here because this was a spot to meet for a bar crawl.   Me and the boyfriend ordered the sampler/appetizer platter and it was HUGE. Me and the boyfriend were definitely satisfied. We ordered beers with no complaints. Nice and cool in a clean glass.  Service was average.   I don't really have much to say, not because it wasn't good- there isn't anything special about this spot. I think everyone has that go to spot where you get what you need, nothing more and nothing less... This is one of those places.   I will say that if you're into people watching, this is a great spot to eat outside.
Food was disappointing. Shepard's pie was soupy and mushy. Only went here because I had a coupon for $25 off. Well, at least I know where not to go next time

Slow service! Football games are on, and if you're in a booth, you have a personal TV!  Coming here during lunch might be a better bet than coming here on game day. Our service was beyond horrendous and we had to ask our server (or any server we could find for that matter) about our drink order several times before it coming over. We were about to leave, right as the drinks came over-- talk about convenient.   It would be hard for me to reccomend this place or even come back here at all. I was so appulded with the lack of service, even before sitting down, that we should have walked through that door.

I dropped in to catch up with a college friend. It's pretty noisy during happy hour, but what do you except - it's HAPPY HOUR! It looks like all of the businessmen of the downtown area hangs out here right around 4:45-6pm.   My drinks were well-mixed and strong = score! They validate parking AFTER FIVE. Don't get here 5min. early or else your parking is only discounted at $3/hr. I would probably check this place out again since my bartender Zane makes the best drinks in the bar!

A large place to go and watch the Penn State Football Games.   The Penn State group in charlotte hosts their meetups and game watching at this bar, and that is what brought me into the bar.     The bar is styled after a Irish PUB, with 1 large bar, 1 small bar and lots of sectioned off seating.   Overall, its a nice place, clean and seem to draw in lots of people from around the uptown area.     Beer prices were normal with "going out uptown" prices.   Food was another story, I eat here a couple times and each time the food was pretty bland.  The mac and cheese was really bad.  The breaded Chicken fingers just tasted oily, same with the fish and chips.  Bottom line for me on this place: come to drink and hanging out, but go get some food else where.  TIP:  Bartenders at the Big bar validate parking for the parking garage.

Very sad to see how this restaurant has gone downhill.  Hubby & I stopped in on Sat. 1/7/17 for prime rib.  Noticed the parking lot was pretty empty, not a good sign.  Had a drink in the bar and were planning to go to the dining room when one of the bartenders told us the dining room was closed (on a Sat. night!!) and we would have to eat in the bar area, we could either stay at our pub table (with a loud TV blaring over my head) or move to one of the tables in the seating area just off the bar which is what we did.  The 2 bartenders were also the only 2 wait staff.  I ordered a pinot grigio, was told the only white wines were chardonnay or prairie fume.  I asked for a red and the waitress said "we have merlot."  Ordered a glass along with water, she turned & left and my husband was not asked what he wanted.  Waitress came back (no drinks) to take our order, we both ordered prime rib.  I asked for a side of rice (listed on the menu) but was told they didn't have any rice so I chose a baked potato.  My husband ordered hash browns.  I also ordered a side salad.  Waitress came back very quickly (still no drinks) and said I could have the salad bar at no extra cost, I said I didn't want the salad but she said it was the same price so that was my choice.  Went into the freezing dining room (guess it was a good thing we weren't eating in there!), the salad bar had shredded lettuce with a few toppings.  Got our meals very quickly along with my wine and water.  My husband went up to the bar to ask for water but the 2 bartenders/waitresses were in a conversation and after a short time he gave up as he didn't want his meal to get cold.  Both prime ribs had a lot of fat but very little flavor.  No au just served with them.  No bread for the table.  My potato was inedible - probably because it was very old and had black on the potato (not the skin).  My husband's hash browns were OK.  We never saw our server until my hubby flagged her down for our check.  Never got my water refilled (it was served in a highball glass so it wasn't a big glass of water), the dirty salad plate was never cleared away, no one asked how our meals were or if the prime rib was done as ordered, etc.  A large group (12 or 14) came in after us and I heard their waitress/bartender say that "a waitress had called in sick so we're doing double duty."  What? - a supper club has only 1 waitress scheduled for a Saturday night???  We will not be back and I won't be surprised if I soon read that this place has closed.

Had lunch here.  The food was good I had the special for Friday, which was salmon, asparagus and mashed potatoes.  What was not so pleasant were the flies that kept circling around our food.  This made the experience very unpleasant having to keep fanning flies away.  We reported to the manager who didn't seemed concerned and said that she would close the door.  Not impressed.

This is only a review for a Sunday during football season as that's the only time I've been there. We were in town and wanted a Steelers bar to watch the wild card game. This place was so fun. We arrived about 30 mins before the game not knowing how busy it gets. We couldn't find a table but we found a good little area to pop up shop for the game. The bartenders were efficient and friendly. The patrons were equally nice. One guy even gave up his barstool to let me sit down. If you're in Charlotte and love the black and yellow, head here...just get there early!
Great atmosphere for before Hornets games! Justin at the upper bar is very attentive too.

We arrived here early on a Friday evening for a fish fry. Since the dining room wasn't yet open for seating, we sat at the bar and had a couple drinks. Drinks were good and service was prompt because there was really nobody else there at that time. My companion and I both like that Fitzgerald's is one of the few supper clubs in Madison where you can get a full salad bar, a well-crafted Old Fashioned, and a loaf of bread comes standard with every meal. The salad bar is pretty decent and one can make a meal out of that alone as it includes two soup options. We enjoyed nice conversation and delicious food in the warm ambiance of this restaurant. Although the prices are not cheap, you do get quite a bit of food for the price and it's a large enough place that you can relax and not feel rushed

This place gets an additional star for location. Right next to TimeWarner Arena and a big parking deck.  James & I stopped in here for a beverage and appetizer prior to the Bobcats and Jazz.  It was busy but we got seated quickly and the service was friendly and professional. We had the  grilled chicken tenders which were good.  An easy walk less than five minutes to the arena. They also have a agreement with the Wake Forest parking garage, free validation from 5p to 3a daily.

Stopped in here for the UNC/Duke game.  Easily found a spot and met some friends.  The pub ambiance works well.  The restaurant is actually huge.  I was really surprised to see all of the space that they have because it doesn't feel big from the outside.  We basically just had beers and apps.  I expected a broader beer menu with some local choices but that wasn't really the case.  Nonetheless, the beer special of the night was $3 pints.  That's totally acceptable.  The only food we got was pretzel bites.  They came with queso and beer mustard.  Overall, I was pleased.  It was a pretty big basket and we were certainly satisfied.  The service was hit or miss.  Our waitress was pretty flighty.  I would return to Fitzgerald's.  It's not terribly fru-fru which I appreciate.
